guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • Arduino
  • Breadboard
  • Solid core wire
Tools
  • Needle Nose Pliers

lines.text: Simply take some solid core wire (I used 22 gauge) and hook it up from your Arduino to your breadboard of choice. You can also add jumpers between power rails on the breadboard for added convenience. You can remove them whenever you need to, but I always have it mounted like this so it works great. No more long power and ground wires!
lines.text_raw: Simply take some solid core wire (I used 22 gauge) and hook it up from your Arduino to your breadboard of choice. You can also add jumpers between power rails on the breadboard for added convenience. You can remove them whenever you need to, but I always have it mounted like this so it works great. No more long power and ground wires!

guide.summary: A simple and elegant solution that I haven't seen anyone else do.
guide.title: Clear Breadboard Power Clutter
